function_call.name: classify_risks_PESTLE
function_call.arguments: {"sorted_risks":[{"name":"Unclear scalability of community-based approaches","category":"Social risks","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Uncertainty about future vector dynamics and disease ecology","category":"Environmental risks","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Risk from other vector illnesses if who targets for controlling vbds are not met","category":"Public health risks","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Lack of community-based studies for mitigating the effects of climate change on vbds","category":"Environmental risks","confidence":"Medium-high"},{"name":"Lack of collaboration between agriculture and health sectors for malaria control","category":"Social risks","confidence":"Medium-high"},{"name":"Incentivizing effective adaptation policies in the absence of visible threats","category":"Political risks","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Uncertainty and ambiguity in epidemiological trends and impact of prevention efforts","category":"Public health risks","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Lack of integration with policymakers and practitioners","category":"Political risks","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Overlapping transmission of multiple parasitic or viral diseases by the same species of mosquito","category":"Public health risks","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Limited attention to the pervasive co-infection in neglected tropical diseases ntds","category":"Public health risks","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Limited investigation of potential interactions between people and triatomine bugs in different landscape fragments","category":"Environmental risks","confidence":"Medium-high"},{"name":"Assumption of homogeneity in social representations and practices of people in geographic, cultural, and economic landscapes","category":"Social risks","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Validation of results between disciplinary teams suggests potential biases and lack of alternative perspectives","category":"Technological risks","confidence":"Low"},{"name":"Failure to consider interactions between distinct pathogens in a common host","category":"Public health risks","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Inadequate consideration of climate change projections in describing the risk of multiple vector-borne diseases","category":"Environmental risks","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Heavy focus on pharmacological interventions and limited attention to environmental management at the community level","category":"Public health risks","confidence":"Medium-high"},{"name":"Lack of clean water and sanitation leading to the presence of intestinal parasitic diseases","category":"Infrastructure risks","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Neglect of co-infection in disease control and epidemiological modeling","category":"Public health risks","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Underfunded health systems and ineffective health governance structures","category":"Economic risks","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Atypical climatic variations leading to rift valley fever and malaria epidemics in east africa","category":"Environmental risks","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Weak community-level outreach systems for public health","category":"Social risks","confidence":"Medium-high"},{"name":"Lack of reporting on coinfection and co-morbidity in existing disease distribution systems","category":"Public health risks","confidence":"Medium-high"},{"name":"Limitations of detail in existing hdss data due to lack of extensive laboratory assessment","category":"Technological risks","confidence":"Low"},{"name":"Widespread use of community volunteers without financial support","category":"Economic risks","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Normalization of existing disease patterns and organizational methods","category":"Political risks","confidence":"Medium-high"},{"name":"Inadequate community participation and empowerment","category":"Social risks","confidence":"Medium-high"},{"name":"Limited examples of institutionalizing participatory approaches in developing countries with limited resources and weak institutional support.","category":"Political risks","confidence":"Medium-high"},{"name":"Inequalities at the local level and gatekeepers silencing community groups from risks","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Intensive educational program emphasizing prevention and curative medicine","category":"Social risks","confidence":"Medium-high"},{"name":"Local ecological factors driving site-specific interventions may not be scalable and applicable in different regions, leading to ineffective disease control measures.","category":"Environmental risks","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Lack of community awareness about the relationships between vector-borne diseases vbds and social, environmental, and climatic determinants may hinder the scale-up of disease control efforts, leading to limited impact at a national level.","category":"Political risks","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Limited access to government outreach programs and risks","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Stigmatization of vulnerable social groups in malaria interventions","category":"Social risks","confidence":"Medium-high"},{"name":"Local perceptions and cultural norms may influence the acceptability and adaptability of program tools for disease control.","category":"Social risks","confidence":"Medium-high"},{"name":"Over-reliance on one or two disease control
